channel.title: Hazard Course
channel.description:
There was a brief disscussion in another thread (I think it was 'Black Mesa 2009 Update') a while back about building a community-made hazard course; But the posts was deleted by a mod for being off-topic. I can't actually remember who suggested this first though (I think it might have been Ibanez?).
At the time I posted some screenshots of an orange mapped section of the hazard course. I have suddenly found myself with some more time atm so firstly is anyone actually interested in this sort of project? And secondly here are the WIP screens I posted before (with some minor improvements that I have made this evening):
[img]https://cpeuk.com/forumscreens/hc1.png[/img]
[img]https://cpeuk.com/forumscreens/hc2.png[/img]
[img]https://cpeuk.com/forumscreens/hc3.jpg[/img]

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: Mented
item.description:
RandomSpoon:

The biggest problem with recreating the Hazard Course is trying to redesign it so that it makes sense, and i’m afraid to say that your WIP shots just seem like you added trim and rounded some edges. Here are some examples of thing’s that are in the original that i feel would need to be changed

You have a point with the first point, all the rest… no.

As for basing it off the PS2 version. Hell yes. I loved the additions.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: Fail-Man_3D
item.description:
Suggestion: Have the ducking exercise (if kept) take place in abandoned sewage/liquid-waste treatment clarifiers and/or API oil-water separators, e.g. have corroded chain-and-flight scrapers under the grating, metal chain guide tracks on the obstacles, marks/rebar indicating that the walls were cut down to floor level at the entrance/exit ends of each section, old spray paint decals/overlays referring to the room’s original purpose, etc.

Edit: Screenshots canceled due to issues w/ Source SDK.

Read full topic

Also the whole Course should be based off of the PS2 version seen in this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FaP53-P6VBI

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

Circle jumps, what the hell kid, youll achieve nothing but clipping the rear of your heels on a concrete ledge and cracking your skull open at the back.

Now how about something realistic like surfing… :retard:

You remind that guy’s face crack in half again…

item.title: Hazard Course

item.description:
Yeah. Stopping exploiting the system isn’t that hard. Getting the game to interface with the server we can’t do…

KKKKAAANNNNEEEEE :3

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
you could pass it thru a motd to a php web server and secure it using some sort of hashing (username, Steam ID, current date time, map, race time). Matching hash generation on the server could verify the integrity of the data. Also user-agent checks, and a strict failed hash check Steam ID ban could deter hacking. (throw in some mutating hash generation and your all set)

Super easy to implement and fairly reliable. But if not programmed properly score fraud would be a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: Cameron_D
item.description:
Hmmm, although something like that would require coding to make it reliable

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
A reminder: that the Black Mesa Hazard Course decathlon will commence this evening at 1900 hours in the Level 3 facility. The semi-finals for high security personnel will be announced in a separate secure broadcast transmission. Remember: more lives than yours may depend on your fitness.

If you take this transmission into account could/should be more like a race with score boards where you want to best other plays times. (online score boards anyone) This is starting to sound like mirrors edge.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
I never liked the Hazard Course, it was annoying and once you got the grasp on how to control Freeman, there was no point in going through it again. Half-Life is simple in terms of what you can do with the controls. There’s no objective, trading, mission or any bullshit like that, so you can’t really get anything wrong. New players have to know that it’s controlled with WASD and the Mouse, that’s about it… I think the way HL2 implemented the in-game popup things at the right moment was perfect, and as I’ve heard it will be like that in Black-Mesa.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course
item.dc:creator: Kisuke_Moto
item.description:
That’s it. I’m gonna start making my own Hazard course. I don’t know why. But when I think of hazard course, I just totally get into it and want to play it. I NEED TO MAKE A MAP WITH IT!!!

WHY AM I FREAKING OUT ABOUT THIS???
